Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

async main.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Confirm email.

Verifies the email confirmation token and confirms the associated user’s email address in the database. If the token is invalid or the user does not exist, raises a 400 Bad Request HTTPException. If the user’s email is already confirmed, returns a message indicating so. Upon successful confirmation of the email, updates the user’s record in the database and returns a success message.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The email confirmation token.

  • db (Session, optional) – The database session.

Returns:

A message indicating the result of the email confirmation.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or the user does not exist (HTTP status code 400).

main.create_contact(contact: ContactCreate, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Create a new contact with a speed limit.

Parameters:

  • contact (ContactCreate) – The contact information to be created.

  • db (Session, optional) – The database session.

  • current_user (User, optional) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

Contact

Raises:

HTTPException – If the rate limit is exceeded.

main.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Delete contact by ID.

Deletes the contact with the specified ID from the database. Requires authentication. Returns the deleted contact if found, otherwise raises a 404 HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • db (Session, optional) – The database session.

  • current_user (User, optional) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The deleted contact.

Return type:

Contact

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact with the specified ID is not found (HTTP status code 404).

main.get_upcoming_birthdays_list(db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Get contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Retrieves a list of contacts from the database that have upcoming birthdays. Requires authentication. Returns the list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Parameters:

  • db (Session, optional) – The database session.

  • current_user (User, optional) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async main.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

User login.

Authenticates the user with the provided credentials (email and password). If the email is not found in the database, raises a 401 Unauthorized HTTPException with “Invalid email” detail. If the email is not confirmed, raises a 401 Unauthorized HTTPException with “Email not confirmed” detail. If the password is incorrect, raises a 401 Unauthorized HTTPException with “Invalid password” detail. Upon successful authentication, generates and returns JWT access and refresh tokens.

Parameters:

  • body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – The OAuth2PasswordRequestForm containing user credentials.

  • db (Session, optional) – The database session.

Returns:

JWT access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

TokenModel

Raises:

HTTPException – If the provided email or password is invalid (HTTP status code 401).

main.read_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Read contact by ID.

Retrieves a contact with the specified ID from the database. Requires authentication. Returns the contact if found, otherwise raises a 404 HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • db (Session, optional) – The database session.

  • current_user (User, optional) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The contact with the specified ID.

Return type:

Contact

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact with the specified ID is not found (HTTP status code 404).

main.read_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 10, query: str | None = None, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Read contacts with a speed limit.

Parameters:

  • skip (int, optional) – The number of contacts to skip. Defaults to 0.

  • limit (int, optional) – The maximum number of contacts to return. Defaults to 10.

  • query (str, optional) – The query string to filter contacts. Defaults to None.

  • db (Session, optional) – The database session.

  • current_user (User, optional) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async main.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Read current user.

Retrieves the details of the currently authenticated user. Requires authentication. Returns the details of the current user.

Parameters:

current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The details of the current user.

Return type:

UserDb

async main.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Refresh access token.

Validates the refresh token provided in the authorization header. If the refresh token is invalid or expired, raises a 401 Unauthorized HTTPException. If the refresh token is valid, generates a new access token and refresh token, updates the user’s refresh token in the database, and returns the new tokens.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) – The HTTPAuthorizationCredentials containing the refresh token.

  • db (Session, optional) – The database session.

Returns:

New access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

TokenModel

Raises:

HTTPException – If the provided refresh token is invalid or expired (HTTP status code 401).

async main.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Request email confirmation.

Sends an email confirmation request to the provided email address. If the email address is already confirmed, returns a message indicating so. If the email address exists in the database, sends a confirmation email. If the email address does not exist in the database, returns a success message without sending an email.

Parameters:

  • body (RequestEmail) – The request body containing the email address.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – The background tasks queue.

  • request (Request) – The incoming request.

  • db (Session, optional) – The database session.

Returns:

A message indicating the result of the email confirmation request.

Return type:

dict

async main.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

User sign-up.

Creates a new user account with the provided user data. If the email address already exists in the database, raises a 409 Conflict HTTPException. Upon successful creation of the user account, sends a confirmation email and returns the new user details.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – The user data for creating a new account.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – The background tasks queue.

  • request (Request) – The incoming request.

  • db (Session, optional) – The database session.

Returns:

The new user details and a confirmation message.

Return type:

UserResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If the email address already exists in the database (HTTP status code 409).

async main.startup_event()¶

Initialize FastAPILimiter on application startup.

This function connects to Redis using the provided host, port, and encoding settings from the application settings. It then initializes FastAPILimiter using the established Redis connection.

Returns:

None

async main.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Update user avatar.

Uploads a new avatar image file for the current authenticated user. Requires authentication. Returns the updated user details including the new avatar URL.

Parameters:

  • file (UploadFile) – The avatar image file to upload.

  • current_user (User) – The current authenticated user.

  • db (Session, optional) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated user details including the new avatar URL.

Return type:

UserDb

main.update_contact(contact_id: int, contact: ContactCreate, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Update contact by ID.

Updates the contact with the specified ID in the database with the provided contact data. Requires authentication. Returns the updated contact if found, otherwise raises a 404 HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • contact (ContactCreate) – The updated contact information.

  • db (Session, optional) – The database session.

  • current_user (User, optional) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The updated contact.

Return type:

Contact

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact with the specified ID is not found (HTTP status code 404).

REST API repository Users¶

async repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

Confirm user email.

Marks the user with the specified email address as confirmed in the database.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user to confirm.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

None

async repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

Create user.

Creates a new user in the database with the provided user data. Generates an avatar image URL based on the user’s email using Gravatar. If Gravatar image retrieval fails, prints the exception. Commits the new user to the database and returns the created user.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – The user data for creating the new user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The created user.

Return type:

User

async repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

Get user by email.

Retrieves a user from the database based on the provided email address.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The user with the specified email address.

Return type:

User

async repository.users.update_avatar(email: str, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

Update user avatar.

Updates the avatar URL for the user with the specified email address in the database.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user whose avatar URL needs to be updated.

  • url (str) – The new avatar URL.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated user.

Return type:

User

async repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

Update user token.

Updates the refresh token for the specified user in the database.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user whose token needs to be updated.

  • token (str or None) – The new refresh token.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

None

REST API service Auth¶

class services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

Authentication utilities.

Provides methods for password hashing, token generation and validation, and retrieving the current authenticated user.

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Create access token.

Generates a new access token JWT.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – The data to be included in the token payload.

  • expires_delta (float, optional) – Optional expiration time delta in seconds.

Returns:

The encoded access token.

Return type:

str

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

Create email verification token.

Generates a new JWT for email verification.

Parameters:

data (dict) – The data to be included in the token payload.

Returns:

The encoded email verification token.

Return type:

str

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Create refresh token.

Generates a new refresh token JWT.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – The data to be included in the token payload.

  • expires_delta (float, optional) – Optional expiration time delta in seconds.

Returns:

The encoded refresh token.

Return type:

str

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

Decode refresh token.

Decodes and verifies a refresh token JWT.

Parameters:

refresh_token (str) – The refresh token to decode.

Returns:

The email address extracted from the token payload.

Return type:

str

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or unauthorized.

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Get current user.

Retrieves the current authenticated user based on the provided access token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The access token.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The current authenticated user.

Return type:

User

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or unauthorized.

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

Get email from token.

Decodes and extracts the email address from the provided JWT token.

Parameters:

token (str) – The JWT token.

Returns:

The email address extracted from the token payload.

Return type:

str

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or cannot be processed.

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

Get password hash.

Hashes a plain text password using bcrypt.

Parameters:

password (str) – The plain text password.

Returns:

The hashed password.

Return type:

str

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
r = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

Verify password.

Compares a plain password with its hashed counterpart to verify their match.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – The plain text password.

  • hashed_password (str) – The hashed password.

Returns:

True if the passwords match, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

REST API service Email¶

async services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

Send email for email verification.

Sends an email to the specified email address with a verification link.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – The recipient’s email address.

  • username (str) – The recipient’s username.

  • host (str) – The host URL where the verification link should point to.
